tool.name: MultTransducerImport

param.name: in_conn_file
param.dialogReference: Path to connection file for the UGS SDE. This will try to autopopulate based on the typical location of the ArcGIS connection files, but you should check it and make sure it is right.

param.name: xledir
param.dialogReference: Folder (directory) where the raw xle files are located.

param.name: well_files
param.expression: xle file {Matching Well Name};xle file {Matching Well Name}...
param.dialogReference: Name of wells populated from the UGGP.UGGPADMIN.UGS_NGWMN_Monitoring_Locations table. If the name is not on the list, then you have to verify that the well is in the database.

param.name: man_file
param.dialogReference: Manual depth to water file. An example file can be found at https://github.com/inkenbrandt/loggerloader/blob/master/manual_measurements_example_file.csv

param.name: isstbl
param.dialogReference: Check box if well stickup is constant over time (and in the UGGP.UGGPADMIN.UGS_NGWMN_Monitoring_Locations table). If not, then designate the stickup in the "Current Stickup Height" column of the manual file.

param.name: tol
param.dialogReference: Tolerance of drift you are willing to accept before the well data are not uploaded into the database. High drift indicates data issues that could not be automatically resolved. Data examination is recommened for sites with drift values greater than 0.3 feet.

param.name: ovrd
param.displayname: Override date filter? (warning: can cause duplicate data.
param.dialogReference: Check this box if you are confident that none of the data you are uploading exist in the database.

param.name: should_plot
param.dialogReference: Check this box if you would like to generate a plot of your data.

param.name: chart_out
param.dialogReference: This is the location where the optional chart would be saved.

param.name: toexcel
param.displayname: Create Compiled Excel File with import?
param.dialogReference: Check this box if you would like an excel file with a sheet for each well imported. This is good for validating the quality of data imported. It adds to processing time if the number of raw files is large.

tool.summary: Processes folder of xle and csv files and loads data into an SDE database table. This tool works with the UGS SDE database, specifically the UGGP.UGGPADMIN.UGS_NGWMN_Monitoring_Locations and UGGP.UGGPADMIN.UGS_GW_Reading tables.
tool.usage: Processes folder of xle and csv files and loads data into an SDE database table. This tool works with the UGS SDE database, specifically the UGGP.UGGPADMIN.UGS_NGWMN_Monitoring_Locations and UGGP.UGGPADMIN.UGS_GW_Reading tables.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Paul Inkenbrandt, Utah Geological Survey, paulinkenbrandt@utah.gov
